$fromAI("filter", "", "string") }}"},"operation":"getAll","returnAll":true,"authentication":"oAuth2","descriptionType":"manual","toolDescription":"=List tasks via the Todoist â€œadvanced filterâ€ syntax.

Parameters  
â€¢ filter (string) â€“ main query. Build it from the userâ€™s words using Todoistâ€™s grammar:  
  â€º Relative dates: today, tomorrow, next 7 days, overdue  
  â€º Absolute dates: 20 May, 2025-06-01  
  â€º Priority: p1 â€¦ p4  (p1 is normal, p4 is extremely high)
  â€º Labels: @reading, @Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğº (label names are case-insensitive) â€” call label_get_all to see acceptable ones  
  â€º Projects / Sections: ##Project Name / ##Project::Section â€” call project_get_all to see acceptable ones
  â€º No date: no date  
  â€º Boolean operators: & (AND), | (OR), ! (NOT)  
  â€º Parentheses allowed.

It's more reliable to use IDs instead of names in query.

Never populate ids, projectId, sectionId, or labelId unless the user provided the exact numeric value (> 0), and in that case omit filter.

Combine multiple clauses with **&** unless the user explicitly says â€œĞ¸Ğ»Ğ¸â€ / â€œorâ€.

If the filter includes @label, assume the label exists; the agent must have already called "Get All Labels".

If the user asks about available filters, mind calling "Get All Labels" to provide correct labels.

If the user asks about available filters, mind calling "Get All Projects" to provide correct projects.

â€¢ lang â€“ (string) user language code; pass â€œruâ€ if the request was in Russian, otherwise omit.

Never pass ids, projectId, sectionId, or labelId unless the user gave the exact numeric value (>0).

Output only a concise list (e.g. â€œX overdue tasks: â€¦â€) and hide raw IDs."},"credentials":{"todoistOAuth2Api":{"id":"OHdgpeDzwODbpE2p","name":"Todoist maxemelyanenko@gmail.com"}},"typeVersion":2},{"id":"13b0cc4d-e965-40ec-87a1-71cf09d2e1b7","name":"Get a Task","type":"n8n-nodes-base.todoistTool","position":[440,220],"parameters":{"taskId":"={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Task_ID', ``, 'string') }}","operation":"get","authentication":"oAuth2","descriptionType":"manual","toolDescription":"Fetch a single task by task_id and show user-readable fields (content, due date, status). ## ğŸ› ï¸ What youâ€™ll need

| Credential         | Where itâ€™s used                        | How to set it up                                                                              |
| ------------------ | -------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **OpenAI API**     | Orchestrator & LLM nodes               | Paste your OpenAI secret key into an **OpenAI** credential in n8n.                            |
| **Todoist OAuth2** | Todoist node **and** HTTP Request node | Log in **Todoist** from your browser to set up credential in n8n. |

> Thatâ€™s itâ€”no webhooks, no extra secrets.
> *Tested with **gptâ€‘4oâ€‘latest** â€“ the fastest & most accurate model in our trials.*

---


## âš¡ Quickâ€‘start (5â€¯minutes)

1. **Import** the JSON template (hit **â–¶ï¸ Try it out** on the n8n template page or dragâ€‘drop the file into your canvas).
2. **Select your credentials** in the two credential dropdowns.
3. Click **Test workflow**. In the sample Function node, tweak the `message` field (e.g. *â€œTomorrow at 9â€¯am: write blog postâ€*). Run â†’ watch your new Todoist task appear.
4. (Optional) Swap the Function node for your favourite chat trigger (Telegram, Slack, WhatsApp, Discord, you name it).

Boomâ€”your personal Todoist genie is alive! ğŸ§â€â™‚ï¸

---


## ğŸ›ï¸ Customising & extending

| Idea                      | How to do it                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Notion / Sheets sync**  | After the Todoist Agent node, add a Notion or Google Sheets node to log completed items. |
| **Voice commands**        | Swap the chat trigger for a Speechâ€‘toâ€‘Text node (e.g. Whisper).                          |

---


## ğŸ¤ Need custom automations?

Want me to build or tweak something for you?
â†’ Email **[maxemelyanenko@gmail.com](mailto:maxemelyanenko@gmail.com)** and letâ€™s make it happen!

---


## âš ï¸ Whatâ€™s *not* included (yet)

* Shared projects & other Todoist **Pro/Business** endpoints.
* File attachments in the comments.
* Editing comments.

Pull requests welcome! ğŸ™Œ

readme:
Turn plain-language chat like â€œTomorrow 9 AM: write blog postâ€ into neatly organised Todoist tasks with GPT-4o and n8nâ€”zero code.

![ultimate_todoist_agent.png](https://n8niostorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/n8nio-strapi-blobs-prod/assets/ultimate_todoist_agent_b61542406a.png)

# ğŸª„ Ultimate Personal **Todoist Agent**

Turn natural-language requests into perfectly-organized Todoist tasksâ€”all on autopilot inside **n8n**.

> â€œAdd _Finish quarterly report by Friday afternoon_ â€ â†’ the agent creates the task, sets the due date & priority, and even drops it into the right project. âœ¨

* * *

## ğŸŒŸ Why this workflow rocks

  * **All-in-one Todoist superâ€‘powers** â€“ create, update, complete, move, archiveâ€¦ every major Todoist endpoint is wired up (tasks, projects, sections, labels, comments).
  * **LLMâ€‘powered intent detection** â€“ an OpenAI model interprets plain-English (or emojiâ€‘filled!) messages so you donâ€™t have to remember slashâ€‘commands.
  * **Minimal setup** â€“ just two credentials and youâ€™re live.
  * **Battleâ€‘tested building block** â€“ use it asâ€‘is, or plug the Todoist Agent node into your own agents & chatbots.



* * *

## ğŸ› ï¸ What youâ€™ll need

Credential | Where itâ€™s used | How to set it up  
---|---|---  
**OpenAI API** | Orchestrator & LLM nodes | Paste your OpenAI secret key into an **OpenAI** credential in n8n.  
**Todoist OAuth2** | Todoist node **and** HTTP Request node | Log in **Todoist** from your browser to set up credential in n8n.  
  
> Thatâ€™s itâ€”no webhooks, no extra secrets.  
>  _Tested with**gptâ€‘4oâ€‘latest** â€“ the fastest & most accurate model in our trials._

* * *

## âš¡ Quickâ€‘start (5 minutes)

  1. **Import** the JSON template (hit **â–¶ï¸ Try it out** on the n8n template page or dragâ€‘drop the file into your canvas).
  2. **Select your credentials** in the two credential dropdowns.
  3. Click **Test workflow**. In the sample Function node, tweak the `message` field (e.g. _â€œTomorrow at 9 am: write blog postâ€_). Run â†’ watch your new Todoist task appear.
  4. (Optional) Swap the Function node for your favourite chat trigger (Telegram, Slack, WhatsApp, Discord, you name it).



Boomâ€”your personal Todoist genie is alive! ğŸ§â€â™‚ï¸

* * *

## ğŸ§© How it works (under the hood)
    
    
    [Trigger / Chat message]
            â”‚
            â–¼
    [ğŸ—‚ï¸ Orchestrator Agent]  â† OpenAI Chat Model + Shortâ€‘term Memory
            â”‚                 â†³ Parses intent & entities
            â”‚
            â–¼
    [ğŸ¤– Todoist Agent]       â† 15+ Todoist endpoints
            â”‚                 â†³ Executes the right call (create, update, complete, etc.)
            â–¼
    [Done âœ…  ]
    

_The Orchestrator is an example._ In production you can drop it and simply expose the **Todoist Agent** as a tool for any other agent workflow.

* * *

## ğŸ›ï¸ Customising & extending

Idea | How to do it  
---|---  
**Notion / Sheets sync** | After the Todoist Agent node, add a Notion or Google Sheets node to log completed items.  
**Voice commands** | Swap the chat trigger for a Speechâ€‘toâ€‘Text node (e.g. Whisper).  
  
* * *

## ğŸ¤ Need custom automations?

Want me to build or tweak something for you?  
â†’ Email **[maxemelyanenko@gmail.com](mailto:maxemelyanenko@gmail.com)** and letâ€™s make it happen!

* * *

## âš ï¸ Whatâ€™s _not_ included (yet)

  * Shared projects & other Todoist **Pro/Business** endpoints.
  * File attachments in the comments.
  * Editing comments.



Pull requests welcome! ğŸ™Œ
